articles.author: Ali Shahriari (MasterPars)
articles.description:
Optimizing performance in C# applications is crucial for building high-performance and scalable software solutions. This article dives deep into advanced performance tuning techniques that every C# developer should know.
üöÄ Garbage Collection (GC) Optimization


The .NET runtime uses Garbage Collection (GC) to manage memory automatically. However, improper handling can lead to performance bottlenecks.
Best Practices:
1- Avoid Large Object Heap (LOH) fragmentation:
Use ArrayPool<T> for large arrays to minimize memory fragmentation.
2- Minimize Boxing and Unboxing:
Avoid unnecessary conversions between value types and reference types.
3- Manual GC Control:
Use  GC.Collect()  cautiously to force garbage collection when you know there is a memory spike.
Example:
// Avoid manual GC.Collect() un‚Ä¶
articles.title: Advanced C# Performance Tuning Techniques

articles.author: Romain Guillemot
articles.description:
In the world of web frameworks, there's often a trade-off between structure and flexibility. Too much structure can feel restrictive, while too much flexibility can leave developers overwhelmed by choices.
With StartER, we believe in finding the sweet spot: providing sensible defaults while giving you complete freedom to adapt as needed. Today, I'd like to walk you through one of the key aspects of StartER: its directory structure.
StartER's core philosophy is simple:
StartER imposes no constraints on the location of an element, as long as you adapt the code to your organization: you have control!
While many frameworks force you into rigid conventions, StartER offers a solid starting point that you're free to reorganize according to your preferences or project requirements.
Here's what the‚Ä¶
articles.title: StartER Directory Structure: Freedom with a Framework

articles.author: Suzy Ross
articles.description:
Life‚Äôs challenges can leave us feeling overwhelmed or uncertain. Dr. Suzy Ross, a trusted therapist, professor, and transformation expert, offers a clear and research-based way forward through her Tool of Transformation. This 30-day program supports deep personal healing, growth, and a renewed sense of wholeness.
Who Is Dr. Suzy Ross?
What Is the Tool of Transformation?
Disintegration ‚Äì When old ways fall apart
Stillness ‚Äì A pause for reflection
Spark ‚Äì A return of hope and direction
Wholeness ‚Äì A sense of being centered and complete
Each phase is designed to guide you with compassion, helping you move through life‚Äôs transitions with intention.
The Map to Wholeness: A Deeper Look at the Process
Tools That Support Your Growth
Short videos that explain each step of the process
Private coaching for personalized guidance
Community support spaces for shared experiences
These resources are built to meet you where you are-whether you‚Äôre new to personal growth or well along your path.
Why This Approach Works
Who Can Benefit
Feeling stuck or uncertain about your next step
Wanting to reconnect with your authentic self
Searching for more confidence, peace, or purpose
The Tool of Transformation is made for anyone ready to move forward-with clarity and heart.
Start the Journey Toward Wholeness
Real transformation doesn‚Äôt happen overnight-but with the right support, it can happen. Dr. Suzy Ross‚Äôs Tool of Transformation offers a kind, insightful, and powerful way to navigate change and reconnect with your best self.
articles.title: A Path to Inner Growth: The Tool of Transformation by Dr. Suzy Ross

articles.author: Bridge Group Solutions
articles.description:
JAMstack and Static Site Generators
Let‚Äôs rewind a few years.
I was working on a simple blog project. Nothing fancy‚Äîjust a place to share thoughts on tech, coffee, and the occasional existential ramble. So, naturally, I spun up a WordPress site‚Ä¶ and within a week, I had:
A caching plugin

Three security patches

A sluggish backend

A white screen of death
That‚Äôs when I stumbled into the world of JAMstack‚Äîand friends, it was like stepping into a clean, minimalist apartment after years of hoarding server logs.
You‚Äôve probably heard the acronym: JavaScript, APIs, and Markup. But here‚Äôs what it really means:
Your site is pre-built at deploy time, not served on-the-fly.

Everything loads fast. Like, scary fast.
Think of JAMstack like meal prepping:

Instead of cooking dinner every night (dynami‚Ä¶
articles.title: JAMstack and Static Site Generators

What is Bioresonance?

In the previous post, we have paid attention on our project structure and organizing the code in multiple layers to achieve better readability and easier maintanence in the future. Now we can focus on long-term sustainability through versioning and testing.
In this final part of the series, we will:
Introduce API versioning so your app can evolve without breaking existing clients
Add unit tests to validate service and controller behavior
Versioning helps your API evolve over time without breaking existing clients. Let‚Äôs enable it.
In the Sample.Api project, install:
dotnet add package Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Versioning


In Program.cs, add the following:
    builder.Services.AddApiVersioning(options =>
    {
        options.AssumeDefaultVersionWhenUnspecified = true;
        options.Defau‚Ä¶

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Japanese investment firm Metaplanet has made its second-largest single Bitcoin purchase ever, scooping up more than 1,000 Bitcoin as the cryptocurrency came within 3% of its all-time high.
Metaplanet said on May 19 that it purchased 1,004 Bitcoin (BTC) for a total cost of around 15.2 billion yen ($104.6 million), bringing its total holdings to 7,800 Bitcoin worth around $807 million at current market prices.
It is the second-largest purchase the firm has made following its buy of 1,241 BTC for $129 million on May 12 in a move that pushed its Bitcoin holdings above that of El Salvador.
Metaplanet has the largest Bitcoin holdings of a public company in Asia and has the tenth largest holdings among public firms globally, according to BiTBO data.
The firm reported a first-quarter BTC Yield of ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Metaplanet scoops 1,004 Bitcoin in 2nd-biggest buy ever

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Coinbase has been hit with a flood of lawsuits after it recently disclosed its user data was breached, with users accusing the crypto exchange of mishandling the incident.
At least six lawsuits were filed against Coinbase between May 15 and May 16, which all made various claims that the exchange failed to keep stringent security protocols to protect user data and handled the data breach aftermath poorly.
In one of the lawsuits, filed in a New York federal court on May 16, plaintiff Paul Bender argued that Coinbase failed to protect the sensitive personal information of millions of users during the data breach.¬†
Users are suing Coinbase, alleging the exchange failed to protect their sensitive data. Source: PACER
Coinbase reported on May 15 that four days earlier it had been hit with a $20 m‚Ä¶
articles.title: Coinbase hit with wave of lawsuits over customer data breaches

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
A recent proposal that aims to change Bitcoin‚Äôs base unit to make it easier to understand as a payment tool has run into opposition, with critics saying Bitcoin‚Äôs satoshis are no more confusing than the dollar‚Äôs cents. 
Bitcoin developer John Carvalho introduced Bitcoin Improvement Proposal-177 on April 23, which seeks to eliminate the concept of satoshis, of which there are 100,000,000 in 1 Bitcoin (BTC), and effectively split Bitcoin‚Äôs fixed supply of 21 million into 21 quadrillion units.
It follows a 2017 proposal from Bitcoin developer Jimmy Song to create ‚Äúbits,‚Äù representing one-millionth of 1 Bitcoin. However, Carvalho said Song‚Äôs approach would still require Bitcoin users to think about decimals and ‚Äúshifts complexity rather than eliminating it.‚Äù
Block Inc. CEO Jack Dorsey is among‚Ä¶
articles.title: ‚ÄòSats‚Äô vs ‚Äòbits‚Äô debate reignites amid proposal to change Bitcoin base unit

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
A group of Coinbase users from Illinois have filed a class-action lawsuit against the crypto exchange, alleging that its identity checks violate the state‚Äôs Biometric Information Privacy Act (BIPA).
Plaintiffs Scott Bernstein, Gina Greeder and James Lonergan claimed in the May 13 lawsuit filed in a federal court that Coinbase‚Äôs ‚Äúwholesale collection‚Äù of faceprints for its Know Your Customer requirements violates BIPA, as they weren‚Äôt notified.
The group claimed Coinbase failed to notify users in writing of the collection, storage, or sharing of their biometric data and the purpose and retention schedule for their data.
‚ÄúCoinbase does not publicly provide a retention schedule or guidelines for permanently destroying Plaintiffs‚Äô biometric identifiers as specified by BIPA,‚Äù they alleged.¬†
The‚Ä¶
articles.title: Coinbase faces lawsuit over alleged breaches of Illinois biometric privacy law

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Bitcoin has notched its highest-ever weekly close as crypto market momentum continues and the cryptocurrency is again nearing its all-time high.
Bitcoin (BTC) has closed at a weekly gain for the past six weeks in a row, and its most recent close at midnight UTC on May 18 was its highest weekly close ever at just below $106,500, according to TradingView.
Its last highest weekly close was in December when it reached $104,400. It later went on to reach an all-time high of $109,358 on Jan. 20, according to TradingView.¬†
Bitcoin is now less than 3% away from its peak price and has gained 2% over the past 24 hours to trade around $104,730 at the time of writing.
Bitcoin also posted its highest-ever close in a 24-hour period on May 18. However, this is not the largest daily gain Bitcoin has made.‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin notches record weekly close after highest-ever daily close candle

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
An Australian man from the state of Queensland has forfeited Bitcoin, a waterfront mansion and a Mercedes-Benz car after Australian Federal Police claimed the assets could be linked to the proceeds of crime.
The AFP-led Criminal Assets Confiscation Taskforce (CACT) said in a May 18 statement that it seized nearly 25 Bitcoin (BTC), alongside the mansion and car, which are together worth a total of 4.5 million Australian dollars ($2.88 million).
The AFP said its investigation began in September 2018 after law enforcement in Luxembourg shared information about suspicious Bitcoin transactions that the agency claimed were connected to the Queensland man, who was previously convicted of hacking a US gaming company.
A waterfront mansion in Queensland was confiscated under the allegation that it's‚Ä¶
articles.title: Australian feds seize mansion, Bitcoin allegedly linked to crypto exchange hack

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Vladimir Smerkis, a co-founder of the Telegram-based crypto project Blum, has reportedly been arrested in Moscow, Russia, on fraud allegations, amid Blum confirming he is no longer affiliated with the project.
The Zamoskvoretsky District Court of Moscow approved a request from investigators to keep Smerkis in custody while he is being investigated, Russian state-owned news outlet TASS reported on May 18.
Smerkis ‚Äî who previously ran operations for Binance in Russia ‚Äî is suspected of committing fraud on a ‚Äúlarge scale,‚Äù pursuant to Article 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, violations of which can result in imprisonment ranging from two to 12 years.
It isn‚Äôt clear if charges have been filed against Smerkis.
Russian news outlet Mash tied the fraud allegations against Smerkis‚Ä¶
articles.title: Russia arrests Blum co-founder Vladimir Smerkis on fraud charges

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Rakesh Upadhyay
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin‚Äôs rally to $105,980 has traders predicting new all-time highs this week. 

Traders lift their end-of-year Bitcoin price targets to $200,000 based on technical factors and institutional investor adoption.¬†

Bitcoin (BTC) has been stuck in a narrow range for the past few days, but the rally above $105,500 on May 18 increases the possibility of an upside breakout. Popular trader Alan said in a post on X that Bitcoin could soar to $116,000 early next week.
Another bullish voice was that of Bitwise chief investment officer Matt Hougan. While speaking to Cointelegraph, Hougan said that a supply shock due to increased institutional demand could propel Bitcoin to $200,000 by the end of 2025. He expects seller exhaustion to occur at the $100,000 level.
Crypto market data daily ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin impulse move toward new highs sets a fire under HYPE, ETH, XMR and AAVE

Today in crypto, Bitcoin has notched its highest-ever weekly close, Telegram co-founder Pavel Durov said he rejected pressure from France to censor Romanian election content, and retired artist Ed Suman lost over $2 million in crypto after falling victim to a Coinbase impersonation scam.
Bitcoin notches record weekly close as it reaches back toward peak price
Bitcoin (BTC) notched its highest-ever weekly close at just below $106,500 on midnight UTC on Sunday, May 18, as the cryptocurrency is again nearing its all-time high.
Its last highest weekly close was in December when it reached $104,400. It later went on to reach an all-time high of $109,358 on Jan. 20, according¬†to TradingView.
Bitcoin also posted its highest-ever close in a 24-hour period on May 18. However, this is not the larges‚Ä¶
articles.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Attorneys for Tornado Cash developer Roman Storm filed a motion asking the court to reconsider the motion to dismiss the case due to the prosecution withholding exculpatory evidence in the form of communications with the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) dating back to 2023.
According to a May 16 letter from Storm's attorneys to Judge Katherine Polk Failla, the FinCEN documents show that non-custodial crypto mixers do not fall under the legal definition of a "money transmitting business" and that prosecutors have known this since at least 2023.
Despite having knowledge of the FinCEN guidance on crypto mixers, state prosecutors still proceeded with cases against the Samourai Wallet developers and Tornado Cash, the attorneys alleged.
Letter sent by Roman Storm‚Äôs attorneys to Judg‚Ä¶
articles.title: Tornado Cash dev's attorneys say prosecutors hid exculpatory evidence

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Telegram founder Pavel Durov said he rejected pressure from a European Union (EU) country to censor political content on the social media platform ahead of the May 18 presidential elections in Romania.
According to Durov, a Western European government, which he hinted at with a baguette emoji, approached the platform and requested it censor conservative voices, which he flatly denied. Durov wrote in a May 18 Telegram post:
"You can't 'defend democracy' by destroying democracy. You can‚Äôt 'fight election interference' by interfering with elections. You either have freedom of speech and fair elections ‚Äî or you don‚Äôt. And the Romanian people deserve both."
The Telegram founder is an ardent defender of free speech, who is highly regarded in the crypto community for his stances on freedom of exp‚Ä¶
articles.title: Pavel Durov rejects EU pressure to censor Romanian election content

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Crypto industry executives are beefing up personal security and demanding more bodyguard services in response to a recent string of kidnapping and ransom attempts worldwide ‚Äî particularly in France ‚Äî targeting investors and professionals in the sector.
According to a Bloomberg report, Infinite Risks International, a private security firm based in Amsterdam, Netherlands, is seeing more inquiries into bodyguard services and more long-term clients signing up for a private security detail.
Additionally, French law enforcement officials recently announced enhanced security measures for crypto entrepreneurs and investors, following at least three separate kidnapping incidents so far in 2025.

The measures include security briefings and expedited access to police lines in the case of emergencies ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto execs beef up security following string of kidnappings: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Nancy Lubale
articles.description:
Key points:

Ether price rose 3% to $2,550 on May 18, triggering $22 million in short ETH liquidations.

A bull flag on the chart suggests a $3,700 target, with analysts predicting Bitcoin‚Äôs price to go as high as $5,000 in May.

Ether‚Äôs (ETH) price was up on May 18, rising more than 2.5% over the last 24 hours to trade at $2,536. This recovery reinforces the optimism among traders that ETH price could hit $3,000 in May, citing strong technicals.
Ether wipes out $7.5 million shorts in an hour
Data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and Bitsamp shows that ETH rose by more than 4.5% to an intraday high of $2,551 on May 18 from a low of $2,440 the previous day.
ETH/USD daily chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
Accompanying Ether‚Äôs losses today are significant liquidations across the crypto m‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ethereum back to $3K in May? Latest rebound says ETH price 'still has more gas'

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Igor Mandrigin
articles.description:
Opinion by: Igor Mandrigin, co-founder and CTPO of Gateway.fm
Every couple of weeks, it seems another layer 2 rolls out, much to the chagrin of some Web3 industry commentators who are concerned about fragmentation. A recent Gemini Institutional Insights report actually noted how a new Ethereum L2 solution is launched approximately every 19 days. In response to the seemingly endless conveyor belt of new zkEVMs and optimistic rollups coming to market, the chorus of criticism continues to grow louder: ‚ÄúThis is definitely the saturation point, no more chains are needed.‚Äù
Some of the most outspoken critics of L2s argue that L2s are redundant, but this is narrow thinking. In many ways, the idea that creating new L2s should be slowed down is like arguing that there were too many websites in 1998.‚Ä¶
articles.title: Don‚Äôt believe the noise: There can never be too many L2s

articles.author: Cointelegraph by William Suberg
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin is convincing traders that an upside breakout is around the corner, with all-time highs in sight.

One target demands $116,000 next week, moving BTC/USD firmly out of its narrow range.

A quick dip before continuing higher is among the options for BTC price action into the new week.

Bitcoin (BTC) reduced volatility to a minimum into the May 18 weekly close as traders bet on a fresh breakout.
BTC/USD 4-hour chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
BTC price brews classic breakout signal
Data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and TradingView showed the area around $103,000 acting as a BTC price magnet throughout the weekend.
Now barely fluctuating up or down, BTC/USD was primed for a liquidity grab, with $105,000 and $103,000 both targets, data from monitoring resource Coi‚Ä¶
articles.title: BTC price to $116K next? Bitcoin trader sees 'early week' all-time high

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Economist and author of The Bitcoin Standard, Saifedean Ammous,¬†has weighed in on the ongoing debate over spam inscriptions on the Bitcoin network, suggesting he would ‚Äúthrow in a few sats‚Äù to fund a full-time developer focused on making Bitcoin spamming more difficult and expensive.
Ammous made the remarks in response to a thread initiated by the pseudonymous developer GrassFedBitcoin, who called for Bitcoin Core to merge pull request #28408, which would enable node operators to filter inscriptions more easily.
According to GrassFedBitcoin, the lack of inscription filtering tools contributes to unnecessary blockchain bloat and undermines Bitcoin (BTC)‚Äôs role as a monetary protocol.
‚ÄúNo one running a node wants to relay inscriptions,‚Äù he wrote, arguing that the OP_RETURN limit increases we‚Ä¶
articles.title: ‚ÄòBitcoin Standard‚Äô author backs funding dev to make spamming Bitcoin costly

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Retired artist Ed Suman lost over $2 million in cryptocurrency earlier this year after falling victim to a scam involving someone posing as a Coinbase support representative.
Suman, 67, spent nearly two decades as a fabricator in the art world, helping build high-profile works such as Jeff Koons‚Äô Balloon Dog sculptures, according to a May 17 report by Bloomberg.
After retiring, he turned to cryptocurrency investing, eventually accumulating 17.5 Bitcoin (BTC) and 225 Ether (ETH) ‚Äî a portfolio that comprised most of his retirement savings.
He stored the funds in a Trezor Model One, a hardware wallet commonly used by crypto holders to avoid the risks of exchange hacks. But in March, Suman received a text message appearing to be from Coinbase, warning him of unauthorized account access.
After ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Retired artist loses $2M in crypto to Coinbase impersonator

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
United Kingdom crypto companies will need to collect and report data from every customer trade and transfer beginning Jan. 1, 2026 as part of a broader effort to improve crypto tax reporting, the UK government said.
Everything from the user‚Äôs full name, home address and tax identification number will need to be collected and reported for every transaction, including the cryptocurrency used and the amount moved, the UK Revenue and Customs department said in a May 14 statement.
Details of companies, trusts and charities transacting on crypto platforms will also need to be reported.
Failure to comply or inaccurate reporting may incur penalties of up to 300 British pounds ($398.4) per user. The UK Revenue and Customs department said it would inform companies on how to comply with the incoming ‚Ä¶
articles.title: UK to require crypto firms to report every customer transaction

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Hong Kong police arrested 12 people involved in a cross-border money laundering scheme that relied on crypto and over 500 stooge bank accounts to launder HK$118 million ($15 million), local news outlets reported.
The syndicate was dismantled on May 15, resulting in the arrest of nine men and three women in mainland China and Hong Kong. 
The suspects allegedly recruited others to open bank accounts to receive proceeds from fraud cases, which were then converted into crypto at crypto exchange shops to launder the illicit funds, Hong Kong Commercial Daily reported on May 17.
The criminal organization rented a residential unit in the Hong Kong neighborhood of Mong Kok to plan and carry out its money laundering activities. Of the $15 million laundered, more than $1.2 million was linked to 58 re‚Ä¶
articles.title: Hong Kong police busts $15M laundering ring that used crypto, 500 bank accounts

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Public internet infrastructure is the critical speed and performance constraint on high-throughput blockchain networks, according to Austin Federa, co-founder and CEO of DoubleZero, a project developing high-speed fiber optic communication rails for blockchains.
"The downside of the public internet is it was never built for high-performance systems. It was always built for this sort of relationship of one big server talking to one little server," Federa told Cointelegraph in an interview at Consensus 2025. The executive explained:
"We have validators all around the world. Rotating leader schedules all the time. And then they switch from having to be massive consumers of data to extremely massive broadcasters of data. So that means that they need huge amounts of resources both on ingress an‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Public internet is a bottleneck for blockchain ‚Äî DoubleZero CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Moody's credit rating agency downgraded the credit rating of the United States government from Aaa to Aa1, citing the rising national debt as the primary driver behind the reduction in creditworthiness.
According to the May 16 announcement from the rating agency, US lawmakers have failed to stem annual deficits or reduce spending over the years, leading to a growing national debt. The rating agency wrote:
"We do not believe that material multi-year reductions in mandatory spending and deficits will result from the current fiscal proposals under consideration. Over the next decade, we expect larger deficits as entitlement spending rises while government revenue remains broadly flat."
The credit downgrade is only one degree out of the 21-notch rating scale used by the company to assess the c‚Ä¶
articles.title: Moody's downgrades US credit rating due to rising debt

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Michael James, the head of institutional business development at Douro Labs ‚Äî the company that developed the Pyth high-speed blockchain oracle network ‚Äî told Cointelegraph that oracle networks like Pyth are disrupting the $50 billion financial data industry that provides critical price information to exchanges, brokerages, trading firms, and other institutional entities.
In an interview at Consensus 2025, the executive said that Pyth Network's data pull model sets it apart from traditional pricing oracles, allowing customers to pay for data on demand, reducing costs for institutions reliant on real-time market data.
Differences between pull and push models in oracle systems. Source: Pyth Network
According to the executive, the financial data industry is currently monopolized by around eigh‚Ä¶
articles.title: High-speed oracles disrupting $50B finance data industry ‚Äî Web3 Exec

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Cath Jenkin
articles.description:
South Africa‚Äôs Garden Route, famed for its lush forests, expansive beaches and charming towns, has become a testbed for Bitcoin adoption.
From Mossel Bay to Witsand and Plettenberg Bay to Knysna, Bitcoin has become popular among shop owners and travelers alike for a multitude of reasons.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre seeing the early signs of a parallel, permissionless economy emerging across an entire region,‚Äù James Caw, founder of SimplB ‚Äî a local crypto asset provider ‚Äî told Cointelegraph, ‚Äúwhere small businesses benefit from faster, lower-cost digital payments and where people have more options to earn, send and receive sound money securely.‚Äù
For tourists, the benefits are immediate: no currency exchange hassles, no international card fees, and the ability to pay instantly and securely. For locals, Bitcoin (‚Ä¶
articles.title: A Bitcoiner‚Äôs guide to South Africa‚Äôs Garden Route

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Merlin Egalite
articles.description:
Opinion by: Merlin Egalite, co-founder at Morpho Labs
Fintechs in the front, decentralized finance (DeFi) in the back: the DeFi Mullet.
Today‚Äôs fintech companies offer excellent user experiences but are constrained by traditional financial infrastructure ‚Äî siloed, slow, expensive and inflexible. Meanwhile, DeFi provides lightning-fast, cost-effective, interoperable infrastructure but lacks mainstream accessibility.
The solution? Combine fintech‚Äôs distribution and user experience with DeFi‚Äôs efficient back end.
The mullet is inevitable
Fintech companies heavily rely on traditional financial (TradFi) infrastructure that is siloed, slow to deploy and run, and costly to maintain. This inefficiency limits their control over costs and product offerings and has potential infrastructure risks. Fin‚Ä¶
articles.title: The DeFi mullet ‚Äî Fintech needs DeFi in the back

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Bitcoin‚Äôs next explosive move could send the asset to $250,000 by the end of 2025, according to Scott Melker, a crypto analyst and host of The Wolf of All Streets podcast.
Speaking in a recent interview, Melker cited growing institutional interest and diminishing volatility as key factors that could drive the next leg up.
‚Äú250K this year, totally possible,‚Äù Melker said, adding that Bitcoin (BTC)‚Äôs volatility has declined significantly in recent years.
‚ÄúIt used to be about three times as volatile as the S&P. Now it‚Äôs less than two times.‚Äù He pointed to increased involvement from pension funds and ETF issuers as evidence of a more mature, stable market.
The shift, he argued, reflects a broader trend of institutional adoption. ‚ÄúThe more institutional money, the more Wall Street money, the mor‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin to $250K in 2025 ‚Äòtotally possible‚Äô ‚Äî crypto analyst Scott Melker

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has held discussions with Everstake, one of the largest non-custodial staking providers globally, to explore clearer regulatory definitions around staking in blockchain networks.
The meeting, which also involved the SEC‚Äôs Crypto Task Force, comes at a time when over $193 billion in digital assets are staked across major proof-of-stake (PoS) networks.
However, despite the massive scale of participation, staking remains in a legal gray zone in the US as regulators wrestle with its classification under existing securities law.
The previous SEC administration also took enforcement actions against major players such as Kraken, Coinbase, and Consensys due to their staking services. The agency, under pro-crypto President Donald Trump, has recently d‚Ä¶
articles.title: Everstake defends non-custodial staking as SEC weighs industry input

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
A man from Wellington, the capital city of New Zealand, has been arrested in connection with an FBI-led investigation into a global cryptocurrency fraud operation that allegedly stole $450 million New Zealand dollars ($265 million).
According to New Zealand Police, the man is one of 13 individuals charged after authorities executed search warrants across Auckland, Wellington, and California over the past three days.
The charges stem from allegations that members of an organized criminal group manipulated seven victims to obtain large amounts of cryptocurrency, which was then laundered through multiple platforms between March and August 2024.
The US Department of Justice has indicted the man under federal law, including charges of racketeering, conspiracy to commit wire fraud, and conspirac‚Ä¶
articles.title: New Zealand man arrested in $265M crypto scam tied to FBI probe

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Panama City Mayor Mayer Mizrachi has hinted at establishing a city-level Bitcoin reserve in a cryptic post following his meeting with two of El Salvador‚Äôs Bitcoin policy leaders.
‚ÄúBitcoin Reserve,‚Äù Mizrachi wrote to X on May 16 after meeting El Salvador-based Bitcoiners Max Keiser and Stacy Herbert.
While Mizrachi didn‚Äôt share details about his discussions with Keiser and Herbert, the timing of the post came 11 days before the Bitcoin 2025 conference in Las Vegas, where Mizrachi is scheduled to speak.
Source: Mayer Mizrachi
The creation of a Bitcoin reserve in Panama City would follow a recently approved measure permitting the use of crypto for public payments, including taxes, fines and municipal fees.
Bitcoin (BTC), Ether (ETH), Tether (USDT) and USDC (USDC) will be accepted once the cry‚Ä¶
articles.title: Panama City mayor teases Bitcoin reserve after meeting El Salvador's Bitcoin leaders

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Paraguayan law enforcement has deported three individuals and arrested another for attempting to steal crypto miners at a facility near the country‚Äôs Itaipu hydroelectric dam.
According to a May 15 statement from Paraguayan prosecutor Irene Rol√≥n, the men were caught by police soon after breaking into a locked section of Teratech SA‚Äôs facility in Coronel Bogado, leading to their arrest.
Prosecutors believe the men may have had ties to Teratech as independent contractors, but are still waiting on official confirmation from the company‚Äôs CEO.
The three deported were Chinese nationals Jinping Duan, Tian Jianyun and Zheng Guanglong, who did not have official entry records into the country. Paraguayan authorities and Interpol believe the men illegally entered through Brazil or Bolivia.
The thre‚Ä¶
articles.title: Paraguay deports three undocumented immigrants after crypto mining theft attempt

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Big Smokey
articles.description:
Key takeaways: 

Traders expect a Bitcoin price pullback to $90,000, but a bull flag could break out to new highs if profit taking near the range highs reduces. 

On-chain data suggests the current profit taking is too weak to extinguish Bitcoin‚Äôs current price momentum. 

Bitcoin (BTC) price has spent the bulk of the week pinned below $104,000 to $105,000, which many analysts have labelled as a resistance zone, but an alternative view suggests that BTC is simply consolidating within a bull flag. 
A bull flag is a continuation pattern that is characterized by a period of sideways price action following a sharp uptrend, and when the structure confirms or breaks from the trendline resistance, the uptrend continues.¬†
BTC/USDT 1-day chart. Source: TRDR.io
While the range-bound trading portion ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin bull flag and standard profit taking hint at eventual rally to new BTC price highs
